title: College football live updates: Georgia-Texas and more
description: No. 5 Georgia is gunning to hand No. 1 Texas its first loss in a must-watch SEC showdown. Follow all the games with us.
author: Yahoo Sports
excerpt: Saturday features two games between top-11 SEC opponents and could go a long way to deciding who is playing in Atlanta for the conference title in December.
text: Week 8 is a big one for the SEC.In the first of the two marquee matchups of the night, No. 11 Tennessee overcame a rough start to knock off No. 7 Alabama, 24-17. We'll see if No. 1 Texas can also protect its house in the evening showdown with No. 5 Georgia.In other action, Brady Cook suffered an early injury before leading No. 19 Missouri back for a win against Auburn in a gritty performance. Also dinged up on Saturday: Travis Hunter. Colorado's two-way star left at halftime after re-aggravating his shoulder, but the Buffaloes didn't need him in a blowout win over Arizona.Defending national champion Michigan suffered its third loss of the season, falling to No. 22 Illinois, 21-7.There's still plenty of worthwhile action on Saturday night. Here are the games we'll be monitoring closely.Time: 7 p.m. | TV: ESPN | Line: LSU -3 | Total: 55.5That three-point line is no coincidence. The last four games in this series have been decided by exactly three points. The Razorbacks are playing their third straight ranked opponent after falling to Texas A&M and beating Tennessee. LSU QB Garrett Nussmeier had his roughest game of the season in the Tigers’ OT win over Ole Miss in Week 7, but it was still a win thanks to the Tigers' defense.No. 5 Georgia at No. 1 TexasTime: 7:30 p.m. | TV: ABC | Line: Texas -4.5 | Total: 55.5Georgia’s second huge road test of the season is the biggest game of the weekend. The top-ranked Longhorns are coming off a blowout win over Oklahoma in Quinn Ewers’ first start since Week 3. html:
Week 8 is a big one for the SEC.

In the first of the two marquee matchups of the night, No. 11 Tennessee overcame a rough start to knock off No. 7 Alabama, 24-17. We'll see if No. 1 Texas can also protect its house in the evening showdown with No. 5 Georgia.

In other action, Brady Cook suffered an early injury before leading No. 19 Missouri back for a win against Auburn in a gritty performance. Also dinged up on Saturday: Travis Hunter. Colorado's two-way star left at halftime after re-aggravating his shoulder, but the Buffaloes didn't need him in a blowout win over Arizona.

Defending national champion Michigan suffered its third loss of the season, falling to No. 22 Illinois, 21-7.

There's still plenty of worthwhile action on Saturday night. Here are the games we'll be monitoring closely.

Time: 7 p.m. | TV: ESPN | Line: LSU -3 | Total: 55.5

That three-point line is no coincidence. The last four games in this series have been decided by exactly three points. The Razorbacks are playing their third straight ranked opponent after falling to Texas A&M and beating Tennessee. LSU QB Garrett Nussmeier had his roughest game of the season in the Tigers’ OT win over Ole Miss in Week 7, but it was still a win thanks to the Tigers' defense.

No. 5 Georgia at No. 1 Texas

Time: 7:30 p.m. | TV: ABC | Line: Texas -4.5 | Total: 55.5

Georgia’s second huge road test of the season is the biggest game of the weekend. The top-ranked Longhorns are coming off a blowout win over Oklahoma in Quinn Ewers’ first start since Week 3. It’s not much of a stretch to say that Georgia will need the best game of the season from Carson Beck to get the win. Ewers got more comfortable as the Oklahoma game went on, but Texas’ biggest strength has been its running game.

Live100 updates

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 9:08 PM EDT

    Arch Manning replaces Quinn Ewers

    Looking for a spark, Steve Sarkisian is turning to backup QB Arch Manning.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 9:07 PM EDT

    Georgia adds FG

    The Bulldogs tack on three more points after a short drive.

    It's 20-0.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:51 PM EDT

    Touchdown Georgia!

    Just like that, it's 17-0. And it's Trevor Etienne again, stretching for the goal line after a 15-yard run.

    It's been all Bulldogs so far in Austin.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:50 PM EDT

    Interception Georgia!

    Now it's Quinn Ewers that misses the mark and throws a pick. Georgia's Daylen Everette comes down with it.

    The Bulldogs have another short field to work with.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:49 PM EDT

    Georgia tacks on FG

    The Bulldogs take advantage of a short field and add on a field goal.

    They're up 10-0.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:33 PM EDT

    Meanwhile, in the other SEC clash of the night, LSU is up 16-7 on Arkansas in what has been a hard-hitting affair in Fayetteville.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:28 PM EDT

    Touchdown Georgia

    The Bulldogs are on the board first after the turnover gives them a short field. Trevor Etienne runs it in from two yards out to give Georgia the lead.

    That'll do it for the first quarter in Austin.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:25 PM EDT

    Fumble recovered by Georgia!

    Now it's the Bulldogs getting a turnover as Texas QB Quinn Ewers gets hit and fumbles the ball in the backfield. Georgia falls on it and has the ball in great position.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:18 PM EDT

    Interception Texas!

    It's another interception on another overthrow by Carson Beck just as the Bulldogs get into scoring range. This time it's Jahdae Barron who comes down with it for Texas.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:16 PM EDT

    The Bulldogs are on the march and in the red zone after a long third-down completion to Trevor Etienne.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:08 PM EDT

    The Longhorns can't do anything on the ensuing possession and are forced to punt it back to the Bulldogs.

    We're still scoreless midway through the first.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:07 PM EDT

    Interception Texas!

    Carson Beck just made the first big mistake of the game, throwing high and away from his receiver and into the arms of a leaping Andrew Mukuba.

    Texas has the ball in great position.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 8:00 PM EDT

    We are underway in Austin, but there's been little in the way of action so far. Both teams have had a possession and a punt.

    Georgia is back on offense now.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 7:41 PM EDT

    Final: Tennessee 24, Alabama 17

    The Vols knock off the Tide in a crucial SEC matchup in Knoxville.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 7:40 PM EDT

    INTERCEPTION TENNESSEE!

    Jalen Milroe throws his second interception of the game on the first play of the drive.

    That'll do it for this one folks.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 7:37 PM EDT

    Vols tack on FG

    Alabama's defense holds strong with the short field and forces a 41-yard attempt by Max Gilbert, who drills it.

    It's 24-17 with 1:30 left in the game.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 7:32 PM EDT

    Bama turnover on downs!

    Alabama goes for it on fourth-and-22 and DOES NOT GET IT.

    The Vols will take over at the Tide 31-yard line with 1:48 left.

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 7:24 PM EDT

    Now the Vols are punting it back to the Tide.

    We're down near the 2-minute mark with UT up 21-17

  • Sat, October 19, 2024 at 7:20 PM EDT

    The Vols have the ball back after a quick three-and-out by the Tide.

    There are just 4 minutes left in the game.
